title: Cause-Effect Display
description: An interactive demonstration of the standard MicroSim structure showing a control panel with input variables (causes) on the left and a visualization area displaying output effects (water state changes) on the right, with immediate visual feedback.
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Education
Instructional Design
Simulation Design
Physics
learningObjectives: Identify the cause-effect structure in educational simulations
Explain how input variables affect output visualizations
Describe the phase transitions of water based on temperature and pressure
Apply the cause-effect pattern to design simulations
prerequisites: Basic understanding of states of matter

controls.name: Temperature
controls.description: Controls the temperature affecting water state

controls.name: Pressure
controls.description: Controls atmospheric pressure affecting boiling/freezing points

controls.name: Humidity
controls.description: Controls humidity level affecting water volume

assumptions: Linear relationship between pressure and boiling/freezing points
limitations: Does not show exact phase diagram
